intro: Machaerium eriocarpum f. mucronulatum, commonly known as the mucronulate machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant features small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, white pubescence, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. The fruit is a slender, hairy pod that typically contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
